text: For promotional reasons (ie tweets), it would be great to have a version of our nilearn with a tagline below it saying "Easier machine learning for neuroimaging". This should be done by first creating a new version of our SVG (https://github.com/nilearn/nilearn/blob/master/doc/logos/scikit-learn-logo.svg) with the tagline, and then exporting it to PNG.
title: Make a nilearn logo with a tag line
Make a nilearn logo with a tag line

text:
> "never more than 2 fonts in a logo".

+1
Better for the fonts, but I would stick to black for the colors.

:+1: 

I am loosing connection (boarding my plane), so this counts as a :+1: for a PR. Thanks!
Give me 2 minutes to polish it because it breaks some basic design rules like "never more than 2 fonts in a logo".

I don't have the cursive "learn" font so I went for the Helvetica used for the "ni" (well, not Helvetica exactly but its free counterpart "Liberation"). Also added some colors.

![nilearn_logo_tagline](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1647301/14736659/85e90906-0878-11e6-8861-0d358b0da3dd.png)
